occupation: President, Chief Operating Officer at Frontier Dermatology
headline: President, Chief Operating Officer at Frontier Dermatology
summary: Innovative and strategic leader experienced in building high performing teams and managing large P&L portfolios. An engaging, collaborative, results-driven and humble executive with a strong track record of success in strategy development, operations, new format expansion, turn-around, start-up, talent management and building winning cultures.

experiences.title: Interim Chief Executive Officer
experiences.description:
Managed transition to PeaceHealth which included implementing a new payroll system, updating benefits for all teams and managing consents for all vendor, payor and provider contracts

Developed FY 2020 budget which was approved by the board and consumed $38M in capital to support rapid clinic growth

Restructured senior leadership team, moving from a team of three to a team of 10 to better support the business strategy

Developed company operations calendar, product roadmap and leadership review process to ensure key business objectives were met

experiences.title: SVP, Retail
experiences.description:
Led company communication, central call center, real-time operations, providers and field teams to provide medical delivery across 37 clinics in Washington and Oregon generating $47M in revenue

Reduced corporate expense by 22% in 2017 while increasing revenue by 17% by rearchitecting medical and retail leadership roles/responsibilities and implementing individual provider dashboards that increased revenue per visit by $25

Improved turnover from 50% of providers in 2016 to an annual average of 24% by upgrading retail team, implementing a company communication strategy, and by implementing standardized visit guides that included individual tracking and coaching on key performance metrics 

Partnered with capital partners and investment bank to support due diligence which led to the purchase of the company by PeaceHealth in late 2018

experiences.title: Vice President, Store Operations - Supply Chain
experiences.description:
Responsible for in-store replenishment strategies, best practices, and omnichannel operations for 1800+ stores, resulting in $72B in revenue and 2% comparable sales growth 

Initiated ship from store in 136 stores to leverage owned inventory, support omnichannel growth and improve speed to guest which allowed for 85% of orders shipped from stores to arrive within 2 days

Drove 40% growth in .com by fulfilling 50% of online orders through stores during peak week 2014 by leveraging ship from store and improving processes for pick-up in store

Initiated RFID technology solution for end to end supply chain and guests to include full chain roll-out in 2016 with a projected 35% improvement in inventory accuracy at the item level in impacted categories

experiences.title: Senior Director of Healthcare Operations
experiences.description:
Responsible for Pharmacy and Clinic Operations across 1800 stores delivering $20B in revenue with approximately 200 Clinicians and 8000 Pharmacist team members

Increased hourly productivity by 9% through implementation of a new $200M technology solution for filling prescriptions

Drove in-store guest awareness of Pharmacy Rewards benefits which resulted in a 50% improvement in Rewards Memberships

experiences.title: Group Director - Pacific Northwest
experiences.description:
Responsible for 65 stores in 5 states in the Pacific Northwest Region  

Delivered $2.2B in revenue with approximately 13,000 team members 

Turned around sales performance by upgrading talent in key positions and streamlining strategy and focus

Delivered 2.9% comparable sales growth (number 2 in chain) and productivity improvement of 3%

experiences.title: District Team Leader
experiences.description:
Responsible for the operations of 11 Target stores located in Minnesota and Wisconsin. Oversaw $505M in sales and 1700+ employees

Delivered 4.1% comparable sales growth and achieved payroll goals every year in role

experiences.title: Store Team Leader
experiences.description:
Responsible for the turn-around of a $35M Target in Rosemont, IL 

Improved profit contribution by $1M in first year by upgrading talent, improving in-stocks and guest experience

Served as trainer for local market – conducted developmental exercises with high-potential executives

experiences.company: The Great Indoors / Sears Holdings Corporation
experiences.title: Director of Operations
experiences.description:
Planned and forecast operating expenses for 21 field units with annual revenues of $600M - $75M in payroll/benefits and $51M in occupancy/miscellaneous operating accounts

Initiated and managed operating expense reduction project which reduced operating expenses in 2004 by $6M through organizational changes, talent and performance management and contract negotiations while maintaining previous year customer service levels

Managed team of 5 direct reports and 24 indirect reports to achieve revenue and profit goals

experiences.company: The Great Indoors / Sears Holdings Corporation
experiences.title: National Manager, Operations
experiences.description:
Executed timely and accurate taking of $100M (cost) of inventory in 21 stores, including the development of action plans for shrink reduction

Developed new return policy for the business which was adopted by Sears retail stores based on successful implementation and first year return reduction of $1M for 21 stores

Established and communicated successful markdown reduction program which accounted for a reduction in store allowances of $2M during the first year of implementation

experiences.company: The Great Indoors / Sears Holdings Corporation
experiences.title: Store General Manager
experiences.description:
Managed 300 associates and market contractor base to successfully deliver superior customer service and profit for the company

Drove largest sales day for the entire corporation in 2001 - $1.7M for the day after Thanksgiving – through lead management, staffing and replenishment

Achieved #1 profit, revenue and customer service increase for company during the first full year of management

education.activities_and_societies: Sphinx Club Honor Society, Ra Ribbon Honor Society

accomplishment_organisations.title: Board of Directors
accomplishment_organisations.description:
http://www.selfenhancement.org/

Self Enhancement, Inc., (SEI for short), is a nonprofit organization helping at-risk African-American urban youth realize their potential. Simply stated, we’re closing the achievement gap. In addition to 100% graduation rates, more than 85% of graduates continue on to pursue higher education or occupational training — many being the first in their families to do so. Amazing results, despite the fact that almost all the young people in our program are faced with significant social, academic and economic obstacles.
